info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:57PM EDT until March 31 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL GRANVILLE...NORTH CENTRAL WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 356 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near RDU International, or 9 miles northwest of Raleigh, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Falls Lake, Rolesville, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Falls Lake Boat Ramp and Purnell. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
